meta_description: WAG-Qaumajuq is one of Canada’s leading art museums, home to the largest public collection of contemporary Inuit art in the world. Plan your visit today!

# WAG Wednesday Nights

Weekly free admission + rotating events 

[ Learn more ](https://www.wag.ca/events/signature-events/wag-wednesday-nights/)

# Help give the art some TLC

Call for year-end donations 

[ Learn more ](https://www.wag.ca/support/year-end-campaign-2/)

# Staycation

The Art of Being Here 

[ On Now ](https://www.wag.ca/exhibitions/staycation/)

# Bîstyek

Forbidden Colours 

[ On Now ](https://www.wag.ca/exhibitions/bistyek/)

# Abraham Anghik Ruben

A sweeping collection from a visionary artist 

[ Learn More ](https://www.wag.ca/exhibitions/ruben/)

# Explore the Virtual Tours

[ Learn More ](https://www.wag.ca/virtual-tours/)

  1.   2.   3.   4.   5.   6. 

# Abraham Anghik Ruben

A sweeping collection from a visionary artist 

[ Learn More ](https://www.wag.ca/exhibitions/ruben/)

##### Celebrating a world-renowned collection of art

[ Qaumajuq ](https://www.wag.ca/about/qaumajuq/)

Playing a dynamic role in the community, WAG-Qaumajuq thrives as a place for learning, dialogue, and enjoyment through art.

WAG-Qaumajuq is a cultural advocate using art to connect, inspire, and inform.

[ About the WAG ](https://www.wag.ca/about/the-wag/)

[ Meet our team ](https://www.wag.ca/about/people/)

[ All Exhibitions ](https://www.wag.ca/art/exhibitions/)

_The first thing you’ll see when you step inside Qaumajuq is a stunning, three-storey glass vault filled with thousands of Inuit carvings._

[Explore the vault](https://www.wag.ca/art/visible-vault/)
